p: In 1942, the low boiling point terpene fraction of Egyptian hashish contained two monoterpene hydrocarbons: p-cymene ( 205) and small quantities of 1-methyl-4-isopropenyl-benzene or dehydro- p-cymene ( 208) [ 95]. Almost twenty years later, an acyclic monoterpene, myrcene ( 202) and the monocyclic monoterpene limonene ( 209), were identified in the essential oil of fresh, wild C. sativa from Canada [ 96].
